message.content:
This is a classic lateral thinking puzzle. The answer is that there are still three killers in the room.

The puzzle states that "Someone enters the room and kills one of them." This means that one of the original three killers was killed by someone who entered the room. However, it does not say that the person who entered the room was not one of the original three killers. Therefore, there are still three killers in the room, even after one of them has been killed.
